root.name: colorMode()
root.description: Changes the way Processing interprets color data. By default, the parameters for fill(), stroke(), background(), and color() are defined by values between 0 and 255 using the RGB color model. The colorMode() function is used to change the numerical range used for specifying colors and to switch color systems. For example, calling colorMode(RGB, 1.0) will specify that values are specified between 0 and 1. The limits for defining colors are altered by setting the parameters range1, range2, range3, and range 4.

parameter.label: mode
parameter.description: Either RGB or HSB, corresponding to Red/Green/Blue and Hue/Saturation/Brightness

parameter.label: range
parameter.description: int or float: range for all color elements

parameter.label: range1
parameter.description: int or float: range for the red or hue depending on the current color mode

parameter.label: range2
parameter.description: int or float: range for the green or saturation depending on the current color mode

parameter.label: range3
parameter.description: int or float: range for the blue or brightness depending on the current color mode

parameter.label: range4
parameter.description: int or float: range for the alpha
